location.physicalLocation: Serge Prokofiev Archive at Goldsmiths College, University of London- Christopher Palmer Collection (1946-1995)

mods.note: Facsimile of copyist score. Inside cover contains liner notes from a recording of the work, along with Shostakovich's The Sun Shines Over our Motherland, Op. 90, by the Moscow Philharmonic and the RSFSR Russian Chorus under the baton of Kiril Kondrashin. The recording was produced by Melodiya in August 1970 (D 01983/4, S 01505/6) ASD 2593.

titleInfo.title: Любовь къ тремъ Апельсинамъ/L'Amour des trois Oranges

location.physicalLocation: Serge Prokofiev Archive at Goldsmiths College, University of London

mods.note: Front page inscribed "Propriété de Serge Prokofiev" in black marker. The first page contains a pasted on sheet with a typed German translation of this page. Inside, the German translation is written in purple pen in a hand that does not appear to be the composer's. According to an added loose note inside, the German translation may have been made for a performance on October 9, 1926 in Berlin. This score also contains a number of pencil correction to the music and text.
